comment.text:
3rd time dining here and this was by far the best time! Partly because Darnell, our server was beyond amazing! 

He was extremely attentive, offered amazing suggestions and his personality was a delight to our experience.

Food was great! I had the Branzino and Creamed Spinach.. my friends and I shared the Brussels and Augratin Potatoes while they each had the Lobster Duo and Sirloin.

All of the food was perfectly cooked- the Brussels were my favorite side as they lended a slnatrual sweetness I'd never experienced - 

The desserts were chocolate cake and crème brûlée- the crème brûlée was perfectly prepared.

Our drinks were a hit also- I'll def be returning for a 4th visit! 

Def ask for Darnell when you go! 


Thank you again Darnell for making my 3rd visit the absolute best visit ever.

Congratulations again on your graduation! Best of luck!

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you for returning to dine with us and for sharing your fantastic experience! We're thrilled to hear that your third visit was the best yet, and that Darnell made such a positive impact with his attentive service and wonderful personality. Your menu choices sound delicious, and it's great to know that all the dishes were cooked to perfection. We're also glad you enjoyed the drinks and desserts.

We truly appreciate your kind words and recommendation. Darnell will be honored by your appreciation. Congratulations to Darnell on his graduation as well! We're excited to welcome you back for your fourth visit and hope it will be just as delightful as your previous experiences.

comment.text:
I absolutely love how the restaurant looks. Beautiful ambiance. 

The service was great we had a very nice server. 

The food I would give a 7.5/10. It was good. I don't have anything bad to say about it be under or overcooked. I've just had better. 

I would definitely visit this spot again.

I would recommend this spot for a birthday dinner or a date night.

I came here for a birthday dinner and although the food was subpar for me, I had a fabulous time! The decor was stunning, and our waiter was incredibly sweet. We ordered a range of items, including the Ahi Tuna Tartare, Oyster Rockefeller, Fire Grilled Wild Shrimp, Dry-Aged Ribeye with Truffle Butter, and Crème Brûlée. Everything tasted average, except for the Crème Brûlée; it was absolutely delicious!
One of the best steaks I have had in quite some time and I eat steak often.  The sides and service were also outstanding.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your kind words! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our steak and that you found it to be one of the best you've had. Our commitment to quality in both food and service is something we take great pride in. We hope to continue providing you with exceptional dining experiences in the future.

comment.text:
I had the pleasure of dining at Little Alley this evening to celebrate a special occasion. 

The food and wine were delicious; however, what made the experience extra special is the exceptional service provided by our server, Jasmine. She was kind, professional, made excellent recommendations (food and wine), and took the time to throughly explain the menu. I dine out often, and the service that I received today it really stood out for me. Going forward, I will make a point to always request her section. 

As for the food, we had the fried lobster and cognac shrimp appetizers - both were delicious, I'd order them again. And now for the star of the show, the steak. We decided to go with the dry-aged ribeye (medium), topped with the bone marrow butter. The steak was flavorful and tender.  (In case it matters, my current favorite steakhouse is Bavette's in Chicago.) We ordered the mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach for our sides. They were pretty good and shareable for 2 - 3 people. 

All in all, the exceptional service and delicious food made for a great experience. I'll definitely be back. Next time I hope to grab a few drinks at the outside bar since it seems like it had a really nice vibe.

photos.caption: Cognac shrimp. The picture does not look appetizing, but trust me, it's delicious

comment.text: High quality food, service was great! Our waiter was very attentive and offered a free dessert sampler. The ambiance is beautiful! Definitely a perfect palace for date night!
Really unique atmosphere, not your typical steakhouse ambiance. Excellent service and one of the best steaks I've had. I love how they give the option of adding the garlic butter from the pan.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your positive feedback! We're glad you appreciated our unique atmosphere and excellent service. It's fantastic to know that you enjoyed one of the best steaks you've had and the option of adding the garlic butter for that extra touch of flavor. We look forward to serving you again soon for another wonderful experience!

comment.text:
Delicious food and drinks from start to finish.  We had the meatballs for a shared app which were delish.  My colleagues had a chopped wedge salad that looked incredible and was huge.   Fantastic steak and sides all around.  And dessert which we struggled to eat because we were stuffed was the perfect ending to the meal.  

The ambience was very dark and moody vibe and the lights were really cool as they were strung across old meat hooks.  Service was superb from start to finish.  Definitely worth a stop if you are looking for a place to enjoy a delicious meal, impress clients or enjoy a great date night.

Cool spot in Buckhead.  Great atmosphere and the food was good, but for the price point I expected more.  I ordered a couple glasses of wine and they were very small pours.  I chose an old fashion for dessert and instead of pouring it over a big rock (which they have), the bartender gave it to me with a glass or regular ice... kind of disappointing.  Not a bad place just not 5 stars for me.
Easy to find. Seated quickly. Thorough explanations provided. Excellent service provided. Tasty options suggested. Wonderful dining environment.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the positive feedback! We're thrilled you had a great experience with easy navigation, prompt seating, detailed service, and tasty suggestions. Creating a wonderful dining environment is our aim, and we appreciate your kind words. Looking forward to welcoming you again!

comment.text: My daughter lives right across the street yet this is the first time we visited. I have mixed feelings. I would definitely come back for drinks and appetizers. We started with lobster bisque and I opted for additional lobster. Had I not I probably wouldn't have eaten any of it. It had no flavor whatsoever. The muscles on the other hand were amazing! We split the branzino, lobster Mac n cheese and creamed spinach. We were disappointed that they all came out cold. The lobster Mac n cheese didn't have a lot of cheese or flavor. The branzino and creamed spinach were very flavorful and a must have. I got the remedy and my daughter got the Cuban. They were ok. The restaurant itself was really nice but our waiter wasn't very attentive. We waited for 15 minutes to put in our dessert order after our table was cleared. The cheesecake of day was delicious! Apple with bourbon Carmel sauce.  Both the inside and outside bars were really nice.

photos.caption: Lobster Mac n cheese and creamed spinach

comment.text:
This is an exceptional restaurant! 

Front start to finish, it was a great experience! 

I want to give a shoutout to our waiter Damani! We had no idea what to get because it all sounded so good, so we actually took his recommendations for our drinks and main course! 

This place is on the pricey side, as expected, but worth every penny!

Everything about this restaurant was incredible. I had to make myself stop eating bc I was full! I had the chicken and it was juice and full of flavor. The meatballs were definitely the highlight of all appetizers- a must get!! Our table had a trio of desserts, by the time those came around I couldn't eat anymore lol. I did try a bit of ice cream and it was super creamy. The sides to order are the Mac n cheese and the Brussel sprouts!

owner_replies.comment: We're delighted to hear that you had such a fantastic dining experience at our restaurant. It's great to know you enjoyed the chicken, meatballs, and desserts. Your compliments on our sides are much appreciated too. We can't wait to have you back to indulge in more delicious dishes!

comment.text:
Rip off. Ordered the lobster appetizer and was charged over $100 per order!  No mention that there was a larger item on the menu. I was also up-charged $4 for my $15 red sangria cocktail - because they claim they added St. Germain - which was not mentioned, requested, nor tasted. We did pay the bill but we will not be returning. Will make posts on every social media channel- including YouTube - 
Avoid 
Also the tuna was absolutely disgusting

The ambiance , the decor and the whole restaurant is a vibe.

We celebrated my bf 33 bday here. He's a huge steak fan so I wanted treat him to something other then Ruth Chris (his favorite)

He ordered the dry aged Bone-in Ribeye - Lollipop Cut medium steak with Foie Gras Butter and a  loaded beak potato 

I'm not a steak fan so I order the sides 
Cream corn 8\10
Truffle fries 10/10
Sweet potatoes 5/10
Lobster Mac n cheese  10/10
Caesar salad 0/10

Above is the ratings for everything!!!

The Caesar salad was disgusting tasted like expired vinegar 

The cream of corn was great lacked seasoning 
The sweet potatoe was ok Ruth Chris is better 
The lobster Mac n cheese is to die for 

Overall our waiter made the experience amazing 
We won't be visiting  again but  it was a beautiful experience

photos.caption: Lobster Mac n cheese  Truffle fries

comment.text: The steak here was one of the best steaks I have had. Food was a warm on arrival but I believe it was because we went outside to take pictures. They do plate your steaks in front of you. They accommodated our large party of 10. Nice ambiance. I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Sirloin with truffle butter and mushroom risotto

comment.text:
My first time here was for a Mother's Day brunch.  The place is really nice, the food was good and the service was great. 
I ordered the ribeye and was not impressed at all.  It was very thin (less than a half inch) and had ok flavor.  The only reason I am giving them 4 stars is because everyone else's food was good.  I tried the filet mignon and regretted ordering the ribeye.

This place definitely maximizes the ways you can prepare lobster, with lobster mac and cheese being the star. It's mostly cheese, then lobster (chunks!) and then pasta is mixed in. No complaints here! On my latest visit I had the chicken which was two large, boneless chicken breast fried and served over mashed potatoes and green beans- easily enough food for two people. Again, no complaints. The key lime pie here is probably the best I've ever had. Definitely recommend. Service was top-tier, as well.

Came here for lunch and it was outstanding! My guest and I ordered steaks, I added on a butter topping which was so rich and melted right into it, we had some appetizers and the cocktails were great. Service was amazing! 10/10 would definitely return

It was not bad, but perhaps not as good as it's reputation. The service started slow. Nine minutes sitting and no one visited the table. Finally got up and grabbed a waiter who picked up our table. Food was good, but not excellent. Fried lobster tail app was a amazing. The prime NY strip was a little tough (med-rare) and cooked unevenly. The patio is gorgeous and it was a very nice setting. The bussers kept leaving carts full of dirty bus trays overflowing with plates in plain sight of diners. I think management is letting things go a bit here. With some effort could easily be 4.5 stars.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for providing your feedback on your recent dining experience. We sincerely appreciate your comments and are committed to improving our service. It's disappointing to hear that your meal wasn't up to our usual standards. We will address the service delays and the inconsistency in food preparation to ensure a more enjoyable experience for our guests in the future. Your observations about the ambiance and the presentation of the dining area have been noted as well. We hope you will consider returning in the future to give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.

comment.text: So to be a top rated steak house in the state and in the country they have a lot to live up to. For me on our trip they didn't do it and I wouldn't go back for what we got. Our bill for 4 was almost 800$ and I can't say it was amazing. We started with drinks overall decent but the individual spriita were pricey. 40$ for my komos rose tequila. Ok for an Atl price. And yummy lots of choices for a steakhouse too. For apps we had crispy lobster- good and hot fried perfectly. Kobe meatballs delish and loved the sauce. Bone marrow -overcooked burnt and really not enough. Also had off menu shrimp with cognac sauce. We didn't like just plain. Wedge salad solid and bacon good.  Steak wise we had a bone in filet, and 2 ribeyes. The filet was way undercooked and then over seared in some places. The ribeyes looked good but needed butters for flavor. The sides were had creamed corn -tasty , the augratin came out cold and we sent back to be heated. The twice baked was good, the Brussels not cooked enough too hard and the fries were yummy and just enough salt. Dessert had the bacon bar and chocolate cake. Cake no good. Bacon bar yummy but very rich one bar would be enough. And needs more sauce. The server Joshua was knowledgeable and very nice and attentive. Not what I expected but maybe it was an off day.

Definitely a 10/10 on all levels, from the scenery, the wait staff, food, etc! Our server Daniel was excellent! He made sure we enjoyed every bit of our experience! Food and drinks were super good! Just superb! Definitely a vibe for date night, girl outing, or just to chill for a good vibe with great food and drinks! Out appetizers were also amazing. We forgot to take pics!

owner_replies.comment:
We truly appreciate your kind words and positive feedback about your recent experience at our restaurant. It's fantastic to hear that you found everything to your satisfaction, from the ambiance and service to the quality of our food and drinks. Our team, including Daniel, is dedicated to providing exceptional experiences, and it's rewarding to know we've succeeded in your case.

We look forward to welcoming you back for more memorable moments, whether it's for a special occasion, a night out with friends, or simply to enjoy our delicious offerings. Thank you for choosing our establishment, and we can't wait to serve you again soon!

comment.text:
Googled most romantic restaurants in Atlanta and this place came up. Asked around and read reviews and decided to give it a try. Made reservations online because I prefer that convenience. 

This place is nestled in Buckhead in the Lenox Park area.  Easy to get to with plenty of parking options including garage and valet. There are a few seating options. There's a smaller bar building outside if you prefer a more bar/lounge type experience with outside seating and indoor seating. I thought this was a pretty modern idea. Upon entry into the restaurant. The ambience and decor are amazingly breathtaking. 

There was definitely social distancing. There wasn't anyone seated at tables right next to each other which I appreciated. For ladies wearing heels, the floors are somewhat slippery so heads-up on that. I had to hold my dates hand so I wouldn't take a tumble. Lol 

We were seated immediately and had the most amazing server. She was extremely knowledgeable of the menu and offered suggestions on what to try. Very engaging and professional. I had the dry aged NY strip with creamed corn, truffle Mac n cheese and Brussel sprouts. Hands down ... flavorful and delicious.   I will most definitely return.

photos.caption: 18 oz NY strip dry aged with black truffle butter

comment.text:
Went back for Easter and service by Jason was amazing! Best service I've had in a while. Food was also great everyone liked their meals. My husband and I ordered our steaks Medium and Medium well and the Medium well came out Well done and the Medium came out Medium Well. When the manager (with the glasses) came over he was rude and said the medium steak looks medium to him. Well it wasn't and he didn't have to be rude about it. He wasn't the one consuming it, I was! If it's not to the customers liking you ask how the customer how would like the steak prepared and so forth. Not go back and forth justifying what you think is right. I was disappointed in his service and it gave off unprofessional subpar steakhouse management similar to a chain such as outback or Applebees. We know that when we patronize a 4/5 star steakhouse, when the steak is presented to the table, we will be asked to check the steak before they walk away from the table and they did not do that here. Very disappointed in management and quality. My moms steak was ordered medium well and it came out medium but she did not send it back. When I asked the manager to explain their temps he said medium is warm thin pink line, medium well is dull pink line, well done is no pink and medium rare is red. So plan accordingly folks when ordering anything other than well done here! 

I also noticed when we were walking out another person who seemed like also a manager tried to tell us bye thanks for coming etc and before he could get it out the manager with the glasses nudged him to pull him mid words to talk to him which was awkward and again unprofessional.

Amazing!!! I appreciated the relative uniqueness of the menu, since steakhouse menus can get pretty predictable at times. The bone marrow appetizer was one of my favorites, and the portions are sizable!

owner_replies.comment: We're thrilled that you enjoyed your dining experience and found our menu to be a refreshing change. The bone marrow appetizer is indeed a unique and flavorful choice. Thank you for your kind words, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another enjoyable meal!

comment.text: Started out the dinner with tequila lemon drops which were just strong enough. Salmon was very well seasoned. Mac & cheese was creamy. Opted for that over the lobster Mac since I don't eat lobster but that is also an option. Brussel sprouts and spinach were also very good. My friend and I couldn't decide which we liked better. The service was great. Didn't check-in too much but was always around if drinks were low. Also, liked that our waiter was able to give recommendations for the meal. Would definitely come back.
One of my favorite steakhouses in the city. I never have any complaints here. The food is always amazing and so is the service. Great environment for any occasion!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your continued patronage and for sharing your positive experiences at our steakhouse. We take pride in delivering outstanding food and service, and we're delighted to hear that we consistently meet your expectations. We look forward to serving you again for any special occasion or casual visit.

comment.text:
Food delicious 
Service amazing 
Ambiance gorgeous with a great vibe 
Would definitely recommend

I was referred to this place by several coworkers, and it did not disappoint. The food was exceptional and the ambiance was PERFECT for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Highly recommend for a date night. Our waiter was also exceptional and very helpful considering it was our first time.

owner_replies.comment: I'm delighted to hear that our restaurant came highly recommended by your coworkers and that it met your expectations for a memorable 1-year wedding anniversary celebration. It's always our goal to provide exceptional food and create the perfect ambiance for our guests. We're thrilled to know that your first-time experience was made enjoyable by our exceptional waiter. Thank you for sharing your positive feedback, and we appreciate your recommendation for special occasions. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

comment.text: Love coming here evey other Friday!!! I'm able to bring my laptop, meet with clients, and of course eat some great food! Today I had oysters and a NY Strip!
The atmosphere, food, and service staff were perfect. On my deathbed, all I ask is to try this meal one last time

photos.caption: Triple Cream Macaroni and Cheese and Sweet Potato Casserole

owner_replies.comment: We're deeply moved by your words! Knowing that our atmosphere, food, and service made such an impact is truly heartwarming. It's an honor to be part of your special memories. We hope you have the chance to enjoy our meal again, but in the meantime, we look forward to welcoming you back for more unforgettable experiences

comment.text: Giving this restaurant 5 stars not only because the food was delicious and the ambiance was amazing but especially for the outstanding service we received from Brianna.  She made our experience even more pleasurable. She was attentive and super knowledgeable about the menu and all her recommendations were spot on.  Will definitely be returning.

owner_replies.comment: We greatly appreciate your 5-star review and the kind words about your recent visit! It's wonderful to hear that you found our food delicious and our ambiance inviting. We're particularly proud of Brianna's outstanding service; her attentiveness and menu knowledge are invaluable assets to our team. Your decision to return is the best compliment we can receive, and we eagerly await the opportunity to serve you again soon!

comment.text: Our first time having dinner at Little Alley. The Food was absolutely amazing. The ribeye steak was cooked to perfection along with the roasted Broccoli. Our service was top notch. We were greeted at the door by our server. Ambiance scores a 10/10. This is a great place to have a date night or to have a family dinner.

My Favorite right now!!!   The butterflied 12 Oz filet with truffle butter is my go to!!!  Tried the mussels and they're a meal in themselves.  My sides were creamy spinach and creamy corn.  Drink are fierce!!!  Basil Hayden was made to perfection!!!  Highly recommend this place !!!!

photos.caption: Center cut filet butterflied with truffle butter

comment.text:
I tend to expect amazing service at a steakhouse, but they surpassed any expectations I had throughout our meal. We were given time to make decisions, recommendations, our glasses were always full and plates were never left empty for more than a few moments. They had tons of options for our toddler who would have licked the grilled mushrooms plate if we let him. The seafood tower was incredible, and the shrimp appetizer was full of flavor. They make a perfect gin martini (not too much vermouth). I recommend the seafood overall, but the guys got ribeyes which were cooked to perfection (medium rare). 

We can't wait to visit again.

Love this restaurant! Outdoor bar has great drinks, bartenders and a cool vibe! Dinner was Amazing! Great service and really good recommendations. Started with a shrimp appetizer that is not on the menu! It was really good and enough for 2 people. Ordered the ribeye (medium well), lobster Mac & cheese, Brussel sprouts & broccoli. The ribeye was juicy, meaty with a little fat. It was cooked and seasoned perfectly! Can't go wrong with the ribeye! The lobster Mac & cheese was also really good! The lobster is loaded on top of the Mac & cheese. Sooo good!! I'm not a brussel sprouts person, however these were so good! Probably could've skipped the broccoli as we had so much food!!!  Definitely going back for a date night!

photos.caption: Ribeye, lobster Mac & cheese, broccoli, & brussel sprouts.

comment.text: My husband and I visited Little Alley on Friday for a pre-New Year's Day dinner date. I made reservations awhile ago on Open Table and when we arrived we were seated right away. I will say the door to the restaurant is a little hidden and a couple of guests, including us, found ourselves trying to figure out how to get in. Nonetheless, we were able to figure it out and it didn't take too long to do so. The restaurant is absolutely breathtaking. It's very picturesque. Once seated, we were greeted by Callie and Nina. Nina assisted Callie. They were both very knowledgeable about the menu and answered all of our questions. They brought us out complimentary bread to start the night off. The bread was okay, but not the best ever. The butter was the best part in our opinion. We started our order off with cocktails and an appetizer. For cocktails, we ordered the Little Alley 77 and an Old-Fashioned. Both drinks were good. The Old-Fashioned was strong, which was good but I thought the Little Alley 77 could have offered more, especially for the price. For appetizers, we ordered the Moroccan-style shrimp. We weren't crazy about this appetizer. The saffron flatbread seemed misplaced and didn't belong. It was soggy and didn't add anything to the dish. The shrimp had a good flavor, but we'd order something different in the future. For entrees, we both ordered a wet-aged center cut filet, along with some enticing steak enhancements (fried lobster and cognac shrimp). In addition, I ordered the mushroom, shallots, and brandy sauce for my steak and we ordered two sides to share: the lobster Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts. This is where we began to really enjoy our dining experience. The meal came alive. Everything was absolutely delicious. We loved the table side service we received when our steak was presented to us. The fried lobster was chef's kiss. Both steaks were cooked to perfection. The Brussels sprouts with the yuzu Béarnaise sauce was fantastic and the lobster Mac and cheese was loaded with lobster. We thoroughly enjoyed this portion of our dinner. To end the night, we had the warm milk chocolate cake. Absolutely mouthwatering! Overall, great experience and great service provided by Callie and Nina. We will definitely be back in the future.

Expensive, yes. But the steaks were terrific. I had the 14oz bone in fillet (kinda special cut you don't see too often). Delicious!  The sides were super tasty. The desserts were crazy good. The chocolate cake, cheesecake, and chocolate peanut butter thing were special. Not a lot to complain about. Perhaps I wouldn't order the charcuterie board again. It wasn't the greatest selection of cured meats I've had but I did like the two soft cheeses.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for your feedback! We're thrilled you enjoyed the terrific steaks, especially the unique 14oz bone-in fillet. We're glad the sides and desserts met your expectations and that you found them crazy good. Your insights regarding the charcuterie board are appreciated as well; we'll take them into consideration for improvement. We hope to welcome you back for more delicious experiences!

comment.text: The atmosphere here is the perfect mix of classic and contemporary. Our server was delightful and attentive, very knowledgeable about the wine selection. The sautéed garlic spinach and mac were a compliment to my bone-in, cowboy cut, ribeye .

photos.caption: Mac and Cheese, Spinach, Sweet Potatoes

comment.text: Arrived early for a dinner reservation and met my party at the bar. Both bartenders, Lexie and Devon, were exceptional.  Hostesses and managers were extremely helpful and professional and friendly.  Our server Nina and the people who worked our table were outstanding. The food, from the seafood tower to the individual meals, were, again, outstanding plentiful, done to perfection.  The overall experience was great and will return.

owner_replies.comment: We're thrilled to hear about your fantastic experience at our restaurant! It's wonderful that both Lexie and Devon at the bar, as well as the hostesses, managers, and Nina, provided exceptional service. We're pleased you enjoyed the seafood tower and individual meals, and that the overall experience was great. Thank you for your kind words, and we can't wait to welcome you back soon!

comment.text: Came here did my birthday and it did not disappoint. My porterhouse was good, could've been cooked for an extra two minutes, but it was soft and tasty. I LOVED the Mac and cheese. Our waitress did a great job explaining the menu to us. And the ambiance was good as well. Just a little too. dim while reading the menu. Will come back again.

My fiance and I love and adore this place! Every time we want to celebrate a special occasion (birthday, anniversary) or even if we are just feeling fancy or steak-y we will come here!

Buckhead location is definitely better than Roswell because 1. Parking and 2. Better area IMO

It may be pricey but for a good steak, it's totally worth it! At first I was trying to find a place that served bone marrow and I got the best of both worlds here.

-The architecture is amazingly beautiful here, the ambiance is also beautiful you can definitely have a mini photoshoot here. 
-Valet parking is suggested only because if you self park your parking across the street in a garage valet is complementary. 
-Drinks: Recommended no one at my table had any issues with their drinks. 
-Food: 2 stars in my opinion only because I cook, the images of their food look amazing but the taste is very bland in my opinion. I ordered the shrimp appetizer and a Caesar salad both in my opinion should be the easiest thing to cook but it was awful my shrimp were under cooked and the bread was very soggy due to the sauce being drenched on it, the Caesar salad was very tasteless. The lobster Mac & cheese was the best thing I experienced there. A friend of mine had a tomahawk steak and he loveeeed it, he also ordered oysters and stated he had better so I guess they were just ok and another friend had the fried lobster tails which looked good he said it was ok so I guess this is the type of steakhouse where you don't order seafood...? Lol I hope this helps.....

photos.caption: Variety of drinks sorry I don't know the names

comment.text:
Before y'all yell at me for this rating, I would like to say I am a steakhouse hater at my core- it's too overpriced for the food they give. I had heard only 5 star reviews for little alley so I wanted to try.

Ok so there were a lot of pros:
- the sides were fantastic: sweet potato was a personal favorite of mine, it was like a dessert 
- soup and salad were also excellent 
- service 10/10 
- location, valet 10/10 

Cons:
- I ordered the tomahawk medium rare & you can see in this picture it is much more leaning to rare. I asked the waiter about it and he tried to explain how it was medium rare and not rare but I've had a lot of steak in my life, and I'm still not convinced it was medium rare. He was explaining how if we got it cooked more it wouldn't be as tough to chew. But medium rare has always been the recommendation for the tomahawk. It was charred on the outside and I had to spit a piece out because it was taking so long to chew. $139 steak and we couldn't even eat it. My dad took it home for the dog and threw out the rest LOL. While I understand I'm probably in the minority for this, i don't exactly have another $139 to waste on another undercooked steak. When spending $500 on a dinner at a STEAKhouse, meat temp is an important thing to look out for before sending out food. 

I'm coming back don't get me wrong. This is the better of the Atlanta steakhouses for sure. I'll be getting the cowboy ribeye next time though to see if it's cooked better

This is my final review for Daniel B's wedding extravaganza weekend.  Everything is kind of out of order, but hey, so is my brain so its all good.  Daniel was kind enough to treat all of his grooms people to a lunch before the wedding at Little Alley Steak in Buckhead.  I had never been, and I had seen (and heard) a lot of things about this place.  We ate @ Mission + Market the night before, which was a few buildings down, so I figured it should be easy to find.

It was only a milish to get there, so I figured 15 minutes would be plenty of time to get there.  WRONG.  1 right turn and 2 lefts took 16 minutes on a early Friday afternoon.  Asinine.  Of course, the valet line was like 10 deep again, I decided to park in the first garage again, since it seemed to make the most sense in terms of location (wrong, I guess that one isn't the one that validates, hogwash).

I walk up and see this sign that says something about politely asking to wear nice clothes.  How pretentious.  Why don't you just say well pick and choose who can come in.  Besides, don't you think its a little to late when you walk up and they say you are underdressed?  I mean, its not like I would bring extra clothes just in case.  Anywho, after going in, it didn't look like anything too special , except the high prices.  I say fuck what you wear, if you can afford it thats what matters.  I didn't see anything too exclusive here, but what would I know.  Long story short, at least the best man wore a Braves tee and he wasn't turned away.

I got seated at the grand table at like 12:02 and it seemed like they were all ready to order.  I mean, damn!  My bad.  You can clearly tell Buckhead is not my home turf.  I scanned the menu (I talked with Jang the day before about what we were gonna get, so we had a little idea what to order).  But it seemed like I literally had a minute to scan the menu.  The waiter (which seemed kind of stuffy to some people, nicer to the others, that was odd) talked about the beef and how they were one of the only places in country with that kind of beef and yadda yadda, so I decdied to see what his sham was all about.  I ordered a prime strip oscar style.  Then he said that they didn't have the king crab but just regular crab (we the hell that means) and went on a spiel how they don't sell the crab from Russia/Ukraine.  I thought that was odd, because I thought the top king crab came from Alaska.  Sooo, the cheaper kind was "only" 27.95 instead of like $37ish.  I should have just skipped that altogether.  I also ordered a salad, and some twice baked potatoes.

We were so excited to hit Daniel in his deep pockets for this lunch- making us miss work and buy tuxes and everything else 4 years in the making (at the time of the original wedding, I was living in Denver, so that would have been a plane ticket too).  I then saw that nobody else was drinking, so I felt like a huge asshole when I ordered a Maker's old fashioned (joke was on the photographer when she said no drinking).  But oh well, it was early and I was hungover.

The salad came out, and that was probably my favorite thing.  It was funny though, the groomswoman had to leave early to get her hair make up done (and they knew that) and I still got my salad before her (awkward, I had no idea she got it or I would have given her mine).  The steak came and so did the monster potatoes (jesus, now I know why they were $11, you can share them between 3/4 people).

The steak was cooked perfectly to temp, but the flavor lacked and it tasted refrozen.  The crab meat was so small I should have used a boba straw to slurp it up.  I think Jang and I were the only jerks who got steaks, everyone else got smaller stuff (oops).  But you know what, I ate like a king, but I didn't waste any.  The thing that pissed me off the most?  They didn't even offer dessert, WTF?!?!?  I mean with all the time we stood around with our thumbs up our asses in the afternoon, I had PLENTY of time for more drinks and at least one dessert.  Lunch was on Daniel, right?  I should have given him my unvalidated $12 parking ticket too, LOL.

It was a kind gesture indeed and a great time for sure, at least talking to the rest of the grooms party.  But it was awkward staring at Daniel, since we were forbidden to talk to him.  Thanks again for the experience, Yelp King!

We returned to celebrate my baby sister's birthday.  The waiter recommended I get the Branzino instead of the Faroe Island Salmond.  The food was good.  There was a long wait. It was longer than the first time I was here, but I understand issues with staffing.  The sweet potato souffle was good but buttery and it had a little too much marshmellow on top for me.  They waiters were excellent, knowledgeable, and very accommodating.  The food could've been a little bit better for me overall but I like the spot.

Restaurant entrance is beautiful. They have indoor and outdoor dining.  We preferred the indoor to keep ourselves cool from the humidity outside. We were a group of 6.
SHY was our server. Very bubbly personality and catered to all our requests. 
We ordered the seafood platter, steak,  pasta....omg everything was too good including the wine. 
Only disappointment was they never gave us the crab cutter to start with.  So we struggling with our hands until we requested one from the floor manager. 
By the time it came we were just too bummed to go through the process of cutting.  Felt like we were at juicy crab...all messy.
This place never fails. I always have some of the best seafood here but what I love most is my husband absolutely love this place. Their steak is great.

owner_replies.comment: We're so pleased to be a consistent favorite for you! It's wonderful to hear that you enjoy our seafood offerings, and it's even better that your husband loves our place for the great steak. Thank you for your continued support, and we look forward to delivering more memorable dining experiences in the future.

comment.text: Overall I'd give it a 8.3/10. The service and vibes were great. Side dishes were incredible, but the whole tail lobster tail wasn't good. The steak tasted like butter, cooked very well but it could have had more flavor. If we go back we'll add a flavored garlic butter on top.

photos.caption: Truffle Mac and cheese and scalloped potatoes

comment.text:
Love love love the food. Steaks are always amazing and their sides are even better. The service is great too as all the waiters are always so skins and responsive to questions. 
Free valet for customers!

owner_replies.comment: We're thrilled to hear you love our food and enjoy dining at Little Alley Steak! Our team takes great pride in delivering exceptional service and ensuring our guests have a wonderful experience. It's great to know that you appreciate our steaks, sides, and the overall service. The complimentary valet service is just one of the ways we aim to make your visit more convenient. Thank you for your kind words and your support. We look forward to serving you again soon!
